cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then expected to turn north into the north-western Caribbean and Gulf of Mexico before curving northeast across the south-eastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (likely Florida Panhandle–Alabama coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch possible later for parts of the Yucatan Peninsula (not issued yet for U.S. coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (Nicaragua, Honduras) Thursday–Friday, then northern Gulf Coast (LA/MS/AL/FL) this weekend and interior Southeast to Mid-Atlantic early next week
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds possible Monday–Tuesday (25–35 mph) but tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤3 % probability)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected this far upriver from the Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–3 inches of rain as the remnant system passes, which could cause localized runoff issues
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban flooding and brief marine restrictions on Delaware River traffic due to reduced visibility and squally bands
